qas.question: What was the name of the interface front-end introduced by Comcast in 2007?
Smartzone used what company's antivirus protection?
The contacts and address book for Smartzone was called what?
When was Smartzone rolled out to customers?
When did Comcast team up with Hewlett-Packard?

plausible_answers.text: merge their contacts into one address book

qas.question: What did Zimbra allow users to do with their contacts?
What was the name of the Hewlett-Packard antivirus software?

context: Comcast announced in <b5_0>May 2007<b5_0/> and launched in <a4_0><b6_0>September 2008<b6_0/><a4_0/> <a0_0>a dashboard called SmartZone<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Hewlett-Packard<a1_0/> led "design, creation and management". Collaboration and unified messaging technology came from open-source vendor Zimbra. "SmartZone users will be able to send and receive e-mail, listen to their voicemail messages online and forward that information via e-mail to others, send instant messages and video instant messages and <b7_0>merge their contacts into one address book<b7_0/>". There is also Cloudmark spam and phishing protection and <a2_0><b9_0>Trend Micro<b9_0/><a2_0/> antivirus. The address book is <a3_0><b8_0>Comcast Plaxo<b8_0/> software<a3_0/>.
